poem:
The Drawings of Victor Hugo

Gale warnings whisper  
in Hugo's ink-drowned hand—  
gothic shadows weave  
through his garden of dreams.  
Surreal blooms unfurl,  
petals of storm and quill,  
seducing the world  
with fantasies drawn  
from the melancholy  
of branches, roots,  
the eternal crisis  
of enduring art.
